newsitem.title: USA: Microtest plans to acquire Logicraft.
newsitem.headline: Microtest plans to acquire Logicraft.

text.p: Microtest Inc, a developer of local area network (LAN) products, on Tuesday said it plans to acquire Logicraft Information Systems Inc, a developer of enterprise CD-ROM networking systems, for $13 million and debt assumption totaling $4.0 million.
The acquisition will be accounted as a puchase, and Microtest expects to post a one-time charge to earnings for the fourth quarter of 1996, it said in a statement.
In the nine months ended September 30, Microtest posted revenues of $38.3 million and Logicraft, for the comparable three quarters, had revenues of $10.5 million.
Privately held Logicraft's CD-ROM networking and optical storage retrieval products provide fastest access to multiple CD-ROM databases.

"We believe that the acquisition of Logicraft positions Microtest as the leader in the rapidly expanding CD-networking market," said Richard Meise, chief executive officer. "Strategically, there is little overlap between the product offerings of the companies."
